meanings.definition: To immerse briefly in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: She was dipping her brush in the paint.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys dipping his cookies in milk.
meanings.sent3: The cat was dipping its paw into the water playfully.
meanings.sent4: The sun was dipping below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The chef demonstrated the art of dipping sushi in soy sauce.

meanings.sent1: The kids were dipping their toes in and out of the pool.
meanings.sent2: The dancer was gracefully dipping and twirling on stage.
meanings.sent3: The bird was dipping its wings up and down in a dance.
meanings.sent4: The boat was dipping with the rhythm of the waves.
meanings.sent5: The fitness instructor showed the class how to do a proper dipping exercise.

meanings.sent1: The road was dipping gently towards the valley.
meanings.sent2: The trail was dipping into the forest below.
meanings.sent3: The graph was dipping down, showing a decrease in sales.
meanings.sent4: The airplane was dipping as it prepared for landing.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster was dipping thrillingly before climbing back up.
